title: Climates during the Spread of Farming in Mediterranean
text:
HG and EF





Baume de Montclus


EM Early Mesolithic Continuation of the hunter-gatherer lifestyle. Pleistocene/Holocen transition. Late Last Glacial Maximum climate. MM Middle Mesolithic Increased specialization in tool production, territorialisation. New climates: new species. LM Late Mesolithic Residenciality increase. Circular mobility to access discontinuous resources in time and space




Franchti cave


EN Early Neolithic Early farmers. Permanent settlements, soil fertility for wheat and barley and climates: sheep, goats, pigs, and cattle. Warm and stable climate. MN Middle Neolithic Crafware, crops and livestock specialisation. Deforestation. Warm and stable climate. LN Late Neolithic Apparition of copper industry. Marginal land brought into cultivation. More variable climate conditions




Periods are quoting moments. We use a conventional division in 3 phases, both for the Mesolithic and Neolithic, a standardized and heuristic way to represent the evolution of a culture. Here it represents, large brushes:

title: Climates during the Spread of Farming in Mediterranean
text:
Radiocarbon data
 https://github.com/ropensci/c14bazAAR https://github.com/zoometh/neonet








NeoNet is one of the numerous existing radiocarbon datasets. That’s why we have developed a getter function within the C14bazaar package for the dataset’s to be harvestable.
